human.detailedDescription: Humans are the most adaptable and ambitious people among the common races. Whatever drives them, humans are the innovators, the achievers, and the pioneers of the worlds. Humans receive no feat from their species, but their backgrounds provide them with exceptional versatility.
roleplayingTips: Embrace your ambition and drive to achieve great things
Use your adaptability to fit into any social situation
Seek out new experiences and opportunities for growth

elf.detailedDescription: Elves are a magical people of otherworldly grace, living in the world but not entirely part of it. They live in places of ethereal beauty, in the midst of ancient forests or in silvery spires glittering with faerie light, where soft music drifts through the air and gentle fragrances waft on the breeze.
traits: Keen Senses (Proficiency in one: Insight, Perception, or Survival)
roleplayingTips: Embrace your long lifespan and patient perspective
Show reverence for nature and ancient traditions
Balance your grace with occasional aloofness

dwarf.detailedDescription: Bold and hardy, dwarves are known as skilled warriors, miners, and workers of stone and metal. Though they stand well under 5 feet tall, dwarves are so broad and compact that they can weigh as much as a human standing nearly two feet taller. Their courage and endurance are also easily a match for any of the larger folk.
traits: Dwarven Resilience (Resistance to Poison, Advantage on saves vs Poisoned)
roleplayingTips: Show pride in your craftsmanship and heritage
Demonstrate courage and stubborn determination
Value tradition and clan loyalty above all

halfling.detailedDescription: The diminutive halflings survive in a world full of larger creatures by avoiding notice or, barring that, avoiding offense. Standing about 3 feet tall, they appear relatively harmlessâ€”and so they have managed to survive for centuries in the shadow of empires and on the edges of wars and political strife.
traits: Nimbleness (Move through spaces of larger creatures)
roleplayingTips: Use your small size and unassuming nature to your advantage
Show cheerfulness and optimism even in difficult times
Value home, family, and simple pleasures

gnome.detailedDescription: A constant hum of busy activity pervades the warrens and neighborhoods where gnomes form their close-knit communities. Louder sounds punctuate the hum: a crunch of grinding gears here, a hammer ringing on metal there, a wizened cough or a huff of exasperation at a failed experiment elsewhere.
traits: Gnomish Cunning (Advantage on Int, Wis, Cha saves)
roleplayingTips: Embrace your curiosity and love of invention
Show enthusiasm for learning and experimentation
Balance your cleverness with occasional forgetfulness

half-elf.detailedDescription: Walking in two worlds but truly belonging to neither, half-elves combine what some say are the best qualities of their elf and human parents: human curiosity, inventiveness, and ambition tempered by the refined senses, love of nature, and artistic tastes of the elves.
traits: Skill Versatility (Proficiency in two skills of your choice)
roleplayingTips: Navigate the balance between elven grace and human ambition
Use your diplomatic skills to bridge different cultures
Embrace your unique heritage as a strength

half-orc.detailedDescription: Some half-orcs rise to become proud leaders of orc communities. Some venture into the world to prove their worth among humans and other civilized races. Many of these become adventurers, achieving greatness through their martial prowess and the strength of their convictions.
traits: Relentless Endurance (Once per Long Rest, survive 0 HP with 1 HP)
roleplayingTips: Embrace your physical strength and combat prowess
Show honor and courage in battle
Balance your orcish heritage with civilized society

tiefling.detailedDescription: To be greeted with stares and whispers, to suffer violence and insult on the street, to see mistrust and fear in every eye: this is the lot of the tiefling. And to twist the knife, tieflings know that this is because a pact struck generations ago infused their bloodline with the essence of Asmodeus, the overlord of the Nine Hells.
roleplayingTips: Embrace your infernal heritage with confidence
Use your charisma to overcome prejudice
Seek to prove that you're more than your appearance

dragonborn.detailedDescription: Born of dragons, as their name proclaims, the dragonborn walk proudly through a world that greets them with fearful incomprehension. Shaped by draconic gods or the dragons themselves, dragonborn originally hatched from dragon eggs as a unique race, combining the best attributes of dragons and humanoids.
traits: Breath Weapon (1d10 damage, choose cone or line)
roleplayingTips: Embrace your draconic heritage with pride
Show honor and courage in all your dealings
Use your breath weapon strategically in combat

aasimar.detailedDescription: Aasimars are mortals who carry a spark of the Upper Planes within their souls. They are often born to virtuous parents and display signs of their celestial heritage from a young age, such as an innate sense of justice or an unexplained ability to heal the wounded.
traits: Healing Hands (Action to heal creature you touch)
Celestial Revelation (Level 3, choose effect each time)
celestialRevelationOptions: Inner Radiance (shed light and deal radiant damage)
Necrotic Shroud (enemies must save or be frightened)
roleplayingTips: Embrace your celestial heritage with grace
Use your healing abilities to help others
Balance divine light with mortal understanding

goliath.detailedDescription: Goliaths are proud, spiritual people who revere the power of nature and the primal forces of the world. They are nomads who live on the fringes of civilization, maintaining a deep connection to the natural world and the spirits that inhabit it.
traits: Powerful Build (advantage ending grapple, larger for carrying)

giantAncestry.Stone: Reduce damage by 1d12 + Con as Reaction
giantAncestry.Storm: Deal 1d8 Thunder damage to attacker as Reaction

roleplayingTips: Show reverence for nature and ancestral spirits
Embrace your physical strength and endurance
Live in harmony with the natural world

orc.detailedDescription: Orcs are fierce, competitive warriors who live by a code of honor and strength. They are often seen as brutish by other races, but they possess a deep cultural tradition of storytelling, craftsmanship, and spiritual connection to their ancestors.
traits: Adrenaline Rush (Bonus Action Dash + Temp HP)
Relentless Endurance (Once per Long Rest, survive 0 HP)
roleplayingTips: Embrace your competitive spirit and warrior culture
Show honor and courage in battle
Value strength, tradition, and ancestral wisdom
